div.span:
Brecksville - Broadview Heights City School District
6638 Mill Road | Brecksville, OH 44141

div.a: Quick Links
Brecksville Broadview Heights City School District
← PREVIOUS PAGE

span.div: In light of recent news reports about COVID-19, otherwise known as Coronavirus, the Brecksville-Broadview Heights City Schools seeks to provide parents and the community with up-to-date news and information related to this public health issue. Please access the resources listed in the right-hand column to obtain helpful information regarding symptoms and prevention measures.

b.span: District News and Updates Regarding COVID-19

a.span: April 21, 2020 – Last Day of Instruction Will be 5/29, Preparations Being Made for Pick-Up of Materials at Buildings
April 20, 2020 - Governor DeWine Orders In-Home Learning for Remainder of 2019-2020 School Year

span.style: font-size: 10.5pt; line-height: 107%; font-family: Cambria, serif; color: #020202; background-image: initial; background-size: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial

a.span: April 3, 2020 – Grades and Student Evaluation Information
March 30, 2020 – Governor Mike DeWine Extends School Closure Until May 1st
March 27, 2020 - Bee One Community Challenge Next Week and Important Instructional Update
March 24, 2020 - Food Services, Technology & In-Service Update, Reminder to Refrain from Organized Practice Gatherings
March 22, 2020 – Update to Parents in Light of Stay at Home Order from Governor
March 16, 2020 – Itinerary for Week of March 16, 2020
March 16, 2020 - Text of Phone Message from Superintendent Magyar - Pause for Community
March 12, 2020 - Governor Mike DeWine Issues Order for Ohio Schools to Close for Three Weeks
March 12, 2020 – District Cancelling School Related Events & Activities Until March 30, 2020
March 11, 2020 – All District Classes Cancelled for Monday, March 16, 2020
March 6, 2020 – District Taking Precautions to Promote Healthy Environment for Students and Staff

span.text-node: Please click the links below to read the full update from the BBHCSD regarding precautions being taken to address COVID-19.

div.span: Ohio Department of Health Call Center

span.div: The Ohio Department of Health Call Center is open 7 days a week from 9:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. to answer questions related to COVID-19 (Coronavirus).

a.onclick: ga('send', 'event', 'URL', 'Link', 'Centers for Disease Control and Prevention');
